intro: Thesium divaricatum, commonly known as the variable thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Thesium divaricatum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its growth habit and floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
